page.title: 01Hares Down, Knowstone
page.content: The most important area in this block is found in the numbers 5 and 6. This is Hares Down. which is 100 acres of unfenced common land. It is owned by Knowstone Parish Council and cared for by commoners. There are farmers who have moor right. They are allowed to run a certain number of animals on themoor. The moor hills remains an aea of outstanding natural beauty especially as the animals, preerring the drier moorland, leave the wet, low center area totally untouched Thus unusual plants and insects survive. In a small part of block aea I is the tiny hamlet of Roachill. This is also part of the Knowstone parish and consists f 8 bungalows and 4 houses. The remaining block area (2,3,4,7,89,10,11,12) are all fenced farming land. This is mainly grassland from moor, although ara I has some
